result.execSummary:
The defendant Daryl Lee Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daryl Lee Brown is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daryl Lee Brown was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daryl Lee Brown not in court.  Kurt Behling appeared for the City of Milwaukee.
Case scheduled for return of property.  Court hears sworn statements from defendant's witness, Felicia H.  
Court GRANTS return of the defendant's phone.  Court DENIES defendant's motion for return on cash.  aw
Return of property hearing on October 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daryl Lee Brown not in court.  Genevieve O Sullivan Crowley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for return of property hearing.  Court grants motion to dismiss due to non appearance of defendant.  aw
Return of property hearing on October 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Case was to resolve as a DPA, however, due to the extended length of the adjournment that is not feasible.  Defendant will be moving out of state for employment purposes.
AS to count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the AMENDED Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 
Pursuant to negotiations court orders count 3 DISMISSED.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 2 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 2 days time served.  
Court orders the payment of costs, surcharges and assessments, DNA surcharge to be paid by 9-4-2015 or a civil judgment shall be entered.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief signed and filed.

Defendant Daryl Lee Brown in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BRANCH 3.

Amended Information filed by the State.
Count 2:  Possession of THC, a misdemeanor offense, 961.41(3g)(3)
count 3:  Attempt Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a Class I felony, 961.41(3g)(am)

Defendant Daryl Lee Brown in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Case scheduled for DPA hearing.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Negotiations ongoing for the terms of the DPA.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 9/4/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daryl Lee Brown in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has offered the defendant a DPA in this case.  Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for DPA hearing on 7/8/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daryl Lee Brown in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel needs time to see if a DPA will be offered.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/19/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daryl Lee Brown in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Nathaniel Adamson for Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-28-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daryl Lee Brown in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. 0Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4-18-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
